content: hey @Jose Costa Teixeira thanks for creating the stub for the Case Reporting IG https://github.com/openhie/case-reporting
I added some front-matter for review and can generate it locally. Not sure what I need to do to push it to gh-pages. I already have the gh-pages branch createdf.
we should also put a back-reference from the HIV-IG to the case report IG when it's published. flagging for @Elliot Silver for the same on the covid-ig
I'm filling that in today with some initial content (i got stuck in a publication step)
about the gh-pages, i'll check if all is there

also, i added some .css to the openhie.css but it doesn't seem to want to stick when generated. any suggestions here? https://github.com/openhie/case-reporting/commit/46668c7f8de0156c6e44c6247d273439414eef0b
what ends up in output/../../openhie.css is the original css which is strange
yes, and it's my bad for not informing: the openhie template is finally working,
so the local template is no longer used.
https://openhie.github.io/case-reporting/ is now working (and brings me 2 issues to fix)
so move the .css changes to the openhie-template in which branch?
are these local changes or fixes that should be applied to all openhie igs?
to all openhie igs, it's for better formatting of definition lists
also, does that mean we can remote the openhie-template from the case-reporting ?
yes, we can
No we can't
thanks @Jose Costa Teixeira for getting the build going https://openhie.github.io/case-reporting/
two issues i noticed. plantuml is not generating and the feedback form isn't there... not urgent.
Yes, I'm fixing those now.
reason for this is that while the openhie template is not trusted, we need to use a local template which is based on fhir-base. And the fhir-base template has been upgraded recently
Is there a change I should be making for templates here?
I will need to stabilize this today (see where in the stack the issue is), then I'll see the gaps in the profiles afterwards
Case report IG structure has been updated to match more closely the IhE Supply one. https://openhie.github.io/case-reporting/toc.html

@Daniel Futerman @Richard Stanley @Ryan Crichton I put a place holder section for Instant OpenHIE. Can we talk about what goes in here? I think stuff like ports opened, naming api end points, software stack and kubernetes deployment info or so
Does that sound right?

@Elliot Silver are you still working on the composition profile https://openhie.github.io/covid-ig/StructureDefinition-WhoCrComposition.html for the hiv-ig or can we start moving it to the case-reporting IG?

I'm not sure if Instant should be in the IG. Workflows are not really instant-specific, they could be used by anyone with a FHIR server I should think. Maybe tests or something like that - that Instant and other tools use? I'm not familiar with IG authorship.

I expect the composition will need further updates--I was expecting it to be COVID-19 specific (did you mean to say covid-ig or hiv-ig)? It may be possible to move some part to the base CR IG and then profile further in the COVID IG.
Is the Composition something that can be used generically by others, including the HIV stuff?
I suspect things like "it must point to a patient" can be generic, but "it must have observations of COVID co-morbidities" will be specific.

@Jose Costa Teixeira , summarizing a chat with @Elliot Silver the plan will be to have a generic Composition, Q and QR, Provenance profiles with some basic constraints in the case-report IG to show how they link and then profile those within the covid, HIV or other content profiles...
see https://openhie.github.io/case-reporting/concepts.html#case-report-forms for more info...
So, the cat finally made it into the build :)
Yes, I think the Case Reporting can provide foundational constraints to explain how data is transformed and then grouped.
shhh! you will let out the secret agenda of infesting global health informatics with cat memes
Clicked on this thread and it's a Friday night, so having to send... OpenHIE-packing-2019-2.jpg OpenHIE-packing-2019.jpg
